DataElement.preferredName: Preservation Technique Biospecimen Preservation Procedure Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Procedures utilized to save substances from decay. Some preservation procedures are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.:Procedures utilized to save substances from decay. Some preservation procedures are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state._Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Procedures utilized to save substances from decay. Some preservation procedures are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Procedures utilized to save substances from decay. Some preservation procedures are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.: Techniques and methods utilized to save organic substances from decay. Some preservation technique are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
Procedures utilized to save substances from decay. Some preservation procedures are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin.

Concepts.definition: Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A specimen that has been subjected to and immobilized by severe cold.

Concepts.definition: A specimen that has been subjected to and immobilized by severe cold.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Tissues which are indefinitely maintained in a viable state at extremely low temperatures.

Concepts.definition: Tissues which are indefinitely maintained in a viable state at extremely low temperatures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:Techniques and methods utilized to save organic substances from decay. Some preservation technique are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
Procedures utilized to save substances from decay. Some preservation procedures are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state.
